question: I am a 41 yr old female (5'4" , 108lbs, non-smoker) who has had diabetes for 27 years.  Last year I had a quadruple bypass and complications from that resulted in surgery on both lungs.  I also had a stroke (left brain stem) prior to the heart attack and bypass.  After I got home from the hospital, I noticed during my recovery, I was having nerve pain, skin sensitivity in both legs and muscle pain in my thigh (left especially).  It has been one year later and I am still experiencing these symptoms.  I am taking nortriptyline  and haven't had much relief.  I should mention I have some mild, but bothersome side effects from the stroke.   I have an upcoming neurology appt. next week and wondered if there were any other avenues I should look into or questions I should ask?  Thank you in advance for taking the time to look at this.
title: Nerve pain and myopathy?
